title: partial_dependence using "rank(number)" as index seems to always error

labels.name: awaiting feedback
labels.description: Indicates that further information is required from the issue creator

body:
I was trying to use partial_dependence() with "rank(0)" as the index and found that no matter what I tried the same error would be thrown (see below).

> [/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/shap/plots/_partial_dependence.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in partial_dependence(ind, model, data, xmin, xmax, npoints, feature_names, hist, model_expected_value, feature_expected_value, shap_values, ylabel, ice, ace_opacity, pd_opacity, pd_linewidth, ace_linewidth, ax, show)
     58     # this is for a 1D partial dependence plot
     59     if type(ind) is not tuple:
---> 60         ind = convert_name(ind, None, feature_names)
     61         xv = features[:,ind]
     62         xmin, xmax = compute_bounds(xmin, xmax, xv)
[/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/shap/utils/_general.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in convert_name(ind, shap_values, input_names)
     43             # we allow rank based indexing using the format "rank(int)"
     44             if ind.startswith("rank("):
---> 45                 return np.argsort(-np.abs(shap_values).mean(0))[int(ind[5:-1])]
     46 
     47             # we allow the sum of all the SHAP values to be specified with "sum()"
TypeError: bad operand type for abs(): 'NoneType'

I had a read through _partial_dependence.py and it looks like whenever partial_dependence() calls convert_name(), it provides it with a value of none for shape_values, irregardless of whether partial_dependence() itself had been provided with shap_values.
